summary: The Veterans Benefits Administration has increasingly turned to contractors to conduct the medical exams that veterans may need for disability claims. According to VBA, contractors help it avoid delays in the claims process. VBA awarded up to $6.8 billion in exam contracts in 2016. This testimony examines VBA's oversight of these contractors. title: VA DISABILITY EXAMS: Improved Oversight of Contracted Examiners Needed
